channel.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)
channel.description:
I've been thinking about some popular series that would be good MMOs to play, and the Avatar series seems like it would be the perfect candidate.
It is an expansive world, with a rich back story It has multiple factions, and different cultures, to appeal to all play styles There are various subsets of talents (Fire: Lightning, Water: Blood)
And most importantly, a following that would secure it as an MMO front-runner.
My idea is that the play style would be similar to WoW, having 3 main classes, and an actionbar based combat system. You would start off with the usual character creation (pick a nation, gender, physical attributes, name), progress through the world learning new abilities, and eventually specializing in a particular subbending style (Lightning, blood, metal, etc).
What are your ideas?

The show is great, and I think the game would be awesome. I feel like it would be hard to implement correct actual bending in PvP or PvM

item.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:442776”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=545460.msg3998215#msg3998215 date=1337569257]
I suppose I should have been mosre specific about that.

What I meant was the 3 main roles (Damage, Tank, DPS).
[/quote]Damage and DPS are the same thing

But yea, you need to create the classes and then assign different ‘trees’ to the roles, not have the roles and then create classes for them[/quote]

You know what I meant.

Traditionally, that’s how it’s been done. First you have a Mage, then spec for Fire/Frost/Arcane. SWTOR is more complex by having different classes, then advanced classes, then specs. My idea was to simplify it, by only having the Nation, a basic set of skills to experiment with both roles, then spec from there. This could be a downside, due to lack of customizability however, but simply not enough is canon for that level. (For example, a Firebender Healer).

Read full topic
item.source: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)

item.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:442776”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=545460.msg3998215#msg3998215 date=1337569257]
I suppose I should have been mosre specific about that.

What I meant was the 3 main roles (Damage, Tank, DPS).
[/quote]Damage and DPS are the same thing

But yea, you need to create the classes and then assign different ‘trees’ to the roles, not have the roles and then create classes for them[/quote]
I think he meant damage as in high-hitting and dps as in, well, dps. For some reason some people like high-hitting classes rather than dps classes, when dps classes obviously do more damage in the end…

item.source: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)

item.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I suppose I should have been mosre specific about that.

What I meant was the 3 main roles (Damage, Tank, DPS).

I’m thinking that there would be a way for every element to fulfill each of those roles. Water and Earth are easy enough to create, but since there’s so little we know about the Air nation, it would be a bit harder. Although, since there wouldn’t be such an inherent rivalry between the nations, like the Alliance and Horde, they could be restricted (like SWTOR). All nations would have a Damage role, and a secondary role, depending on the nation (Earth would have tank, Water would be Healing, etc).

Read full topic
item.source: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)

item.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender / Legend of Korra MMO (Idea)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Really you’d have to have the ‘races’ be the different elemental locations, but what would the classes be (you said there are three?). All I can think of is:

water tribe -> bender, warrior, ???
air nomad -> bender, monk, ???
earth kingdom -> bender, warrior, ???
fire kingdom -> bender, warrior, engineer

And then you’d have some sort of similar talent system for each class (earth benders can be swamp, rock, etc; fire warriors can be lancers or sword fighters, water benders can be ice or water or whatever)

Read full topic
